result.execSummary:
The defendant William E. Parrish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Absolute sobriety at all times. Not to possess any alcohol.  
Not to use, possess, or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia.

Provide DNA sample if not previously submitted.
Continue counseling with Mauston DHS caseworker and Vernon County DHS.
AODA & Mental Health treatment.
Write an apology letter to Conrad Parrish.
Enroll in NA and attend meetings.
Continue with medications.
No contact with Patricia Harris.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
